meanings.definition: A substance used to fill gaps or spaces.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used wood fillers to fix the holes in the floorboards.
meanings.sent2: I need some fillers to patch up the cracks in the wall.
meanings.sent3: The fillers in the wall made it look as good as new.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a filler, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The fillers in the cake added extra sweetness and flavor.

meanings.definition: Words or phrases used to fill pauses in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Um, fillers like 'uh' and 'you know' can help you think of what to say next.
meanings.sent2: Fillers like 'well' and 'actually' can make your speech sound more fluent.
meanings.sent3: The comedian used fillers to keep the audience engaged during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter served as a filler, breaking the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Using fillers in your writing can help maintain the flow of your ideas.
